message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new method to quantify task similarity, which is a core concept in various machine learning paradigms. The paper also mentions transfer learning, which is a subfield of machine learning. 

The paper also involves comparing datasets, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision) as image datasets are commonly used in computer vision research. 

The use of optimal transport in the proposed distance measure suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as optimal transport is a mathematical tool commonly used in AI research. 

The paper's focus on comparing datasets and its use of mathematical tools also suggest that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). 

Finally, the paper's use of transfer learning and machine learning techniques suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as these techniques are commonly used in neural network research.
